item.title: In the world of animal models, naked mole rats are the supermodels. They rarely get cancer, are resistant to some types of pain, and can survive up to 18 minutes without oxygen. item.title: In this instance, the key was the phrase "we understood what the soft whisper meant". Read it out loud. Do you hear the pleasant rhythm? When I heard myself dictating that phrase into my phone (it came to me though some subconscious process) I knew it was a keeper.
item.description: In this instance, the key was the phrase "we understood what the soft whisper meant". Read it out loud. Do you hear the pleasant rhythm? When I heard myself dictating that phrase into my phone (it came to me though some subconscious process) I knew it was a keeper.
item.content:encoded: In this instance, the key was the phrase "we understood what the soft whisper meant". Read it out loud. Do you hear the pleasant rhythm? When I heard myself dictating that phrase into my phone (it came to me though some subconscious process) I knew it was a keeper.

item.title: Lets talk about intelligence saturation, the most important puzzle of the AI danger debate imho. Intelligence saturation is if for a task, with increasing intelligence you get decreasing returns in efficiency. It is the natural tendency that stabilizes everything.
item.description: Lets talk about intelligence saturation, the most important puzzle of the AI danger debate imho. Intelligence saturation is if for a task, with increasing intelligence you get decreasing returns in efficiency. It is the natural tendency that stabilizes everything.
item.content:encoded: Lets talk about intelligence saturation, the most important puzzle of the AI danger debate imho. Intelligence saturation is if for a task, with increasing intelligence you get decreasing returns in efficiency. It is the natural tendency that stabilizes everything.

item.title: Let us say we want to make a good latte (yes I have problems with them). We can improve it with some intelligence (set right temperature). We can further improve it with more intelligence (PID ftw). We can yet further improve our shots with decent coffee machine and optimize.
item.description: Let us say we want to make a good latte (yes I have problems with them). We can improve it with some intelligence (set right temperature). We can further improve it with more intelligence (PID ftw). We can yet further improve our shots with decent coffee machine and optimize.
item.content:encoded: Let us say we want to make a good latte (yes I have problems with them). We can improve it with some intelligence (set right temperature). We can further improve it with more intelligence (PID ftw). We can yet further improve our shots with decent coffee machine and optimize.

item.title: But in the end, we gain a lot through right temperature, less through the PID, and much less for stabilizing the whole pressure/temperature profile. We have intelligence saturation.
item.description: But in the end, we gain a lot through right temperature, less through the PID, and much less for stabilizing the whole pressure/temperature profile. We have intelligence saturation.
item.content:encoded: But in the end, we gain a lot through right temperature, less through the PID, and much less for stabilizing the whole pressure/temperature profile. We have intelligence saturation.

item.title: The same is true when moving goods from a to b. When producing goods. When building things. In all these areas, runaway intelligence is not a thing that can exist.
item.description: The same is true when moving goods from a to b. When producing goods. When building things. In all these areas, runaway intelligence is not a thing that can exist.
item.content:encoded: The same is true when moving goods from a to b. When producing goods. When building things. In all these areas, runaway intelligence is not a thing that can exist.

item.title: Now, why does it feel different to the AI community? They work exactly in those areas where intelligence saturation does not seem to exist. PR, Ads, etc.
item.description: Now, why does it feel different to the AI community? They work exactly in those areas where intelligence saturation does not seem to exist. PR, Ads, etc.
item.content:encoded: Now, why does it feel different to the AI community? They work exactly in those areas where intelligence saturation does not seem to exist. PR, Ads, etc.

item.title: But is this locally superlinear? A bad ad has some effect on a human. A better effect has a bit more of an effect. Targeting adds a bit over that etc. So AI/ human interaction arguably also has intelligence saturation.
item.description: But is this locally superlinear? A bad ad has some effect on a human. A better effect has a bit more of an effect. Targeting adds a bit over that etc. So AI/ human interaction arguably also has intelligence saturation.
item.content:encoded: But is this locally superlinear? A bad ad has some effect on a human. A better effect has a bit more of an effect. Targeting adds a bit over that etc. So AI/ human interaction arguably also has intelligence saturation.

item.title: But this is arguably an illusion. Those areas feel like benefits to intelligence are superlinear. Why? Deploying intelligence in those domains is effectively free. So it is effectively a winner take all market. Hence, locally, benefits are superlinear.
item.description: But this is arguably an illusion. Those areas feel like benefits to intelligence are superlinear. Why? Deploying intelligence in those domains is effectively free. So it is effectively a winner take all market. Hence, locally, benefits are superlinear.
item.content:encoded: But this is arguably an illusion. Those areas feel like benefits to intelligence are superlinear. Why? Deploying intelligence in those domains is effectively free. So it is effectively a winner take all market. Hence, locally, benefits are superlinear.

item.title: But the overall system does have intelligence saturation. The apparently non-saturating parts of intelligence compete for the decreasing amounts of extra benefits appearing in real world tasks. Which are all individually saturating. The market grows by new intelligence use cases
item.description: But the overall system does have intelligence saturation. The apparently non-saturating parts of intelligence compete for the decreasing amounts of extra benefits appearing in real world tasks. Which are all individually saturating. The market grows by new intelligence use cases
item.content:encoded: But the overall system does have intelligence saturation. The apparently non-saturating parts of intelligence compete for the decreasing amounts of extra benefits appearing in real world tasks. Which are all individually saturating. The market grows by new intelligence use cases

item.title: Now, what do I conclude from this? the winner take all dynamics of the AI market are dangerous from an antitrust perspective. The existential risks come from one AI obtaining too much power. The problem, however, is not very dissimilar to regulating businesses.
item.description: Now, what do I conclude from this? the winner take all dynamics of the AI market are dangerous from an antitrust perspective. The existential risks come from one AI obtaining too much power. The problem, however, is not very dissimilar to regulating businesses.
item.content:encoded: Now, what do I conclude from this? the winner take all dynamics of the AI market are dangerous from an antitrust perspective. The existential risks come from one AI obtaining too much power. The problem, however, is not very dissimilar to regulating businesses.

item.title: Break the AI market into many independent players. Work on regulating big companies. Define maximal sizes for deployed homogeneous AI systems.
item.description: Break the AI market into many independent players. Work on regulating big companies. Define maximal sizes for deployed homogeneous AI systems.
item.content:encoded: Break the AI market into many independent players. Work on regulating big companies. Define maximal sizes for deployed homogeneous AI systems.

item.title: Had an amazing time speaking about neuro & AI at NETI at UT Austin. It feels like we're living in the good old days: shiny new data (neuropixels & Ca imaging) and theoretical tools (task-driven neural networks) are colliding to give us new insights into the brain. 1/

item.title: Neuro is hard. Making real progress in neuroAI requires getting into the weeds of neuroscience while also keeping one's ears to the ground to listen for new (and old!) ideas in artificial intelligence. It's exhausting and stressful and exciting all the same 3/
